actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to improve the efficiency of Federal agencies by requiring the completion of rule making proceedings in a timely manner.
short_title: Federal Rule Making Timetable Act of 1979

summary.text: Federal Rule Making Timetable Act of 1979 - Directs each Federal agency to establish a timetable for each class of rulemaking proceeding conducted by that agency. Requires an agency to publish in the Federal Register: (1) an explanation of any change in the timetable for any individual, or class of proceeding; and (2) the revised timetable for such proceeding.

titles.title: Federal Rule Making Timetable Act of 1979
A bill to improve the efficiency of Federal agencies by requiring the completion of rule making proceedings in a timely manner.
